title: Zeke Herald needs some spice
body:
{{item:3050}} 
+250 health
+20% cooldown reduction
UNIQUE: Nearby allied champions gain +20 attack damage and +10% life steal. (1100 Range)

I have not seen this item built since season 4 preseason. Not by top laners nor supports, I personally think that it needs a little buff, maybe some more health so it's more viable for top laners or possibly point runner. I don't personally know what exactly would be best but hopefully you all can think of something :)

Edit: I played Shen support in ranked just now and built it after my {{item:3401}}, I got to say it's an amazing item if you have the right team for it. We had {{champion:92}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:90}} and me as {{champion:98}}. Let's say between the 10% life steal and +20 dmg and my Ult and {{item:3401}} we were unkillable. Even {{champion:90}} benefitted from the lifesteal enough. 

Though it was a good item I still feel as if it needs more.

replies.body:
When I support, my major issue with Zeke's is that it has too much CDR. It's a great niche item, but to be a niche purchase it needs to give 10% CDR so you can fit it into the third/fourth purchase on a support, where they typically will have 5-10% from runes and masteries, 10% from gold item, and 10-20% from Grail/Crucible/Morello's/Locket. For those cases where you buy Crucible or Locket, giving you 25-30% CDR, Zeke's would be a great addition in specific team comps, but you waste 5-10% CDR, making it not worth the cost.

I would personally buy Zeke's a lot more often if it gave 10% CDR and had more defense stats, either higher HP or a meager amount of armor/mr. Lowering the cost as compensation instead of redistributing stats would be unacceptable, as it's already very slot-inefficient.

Apparently you didn't watch game 5 between Liquid and Impulse in the Spring Split Playoffs last week...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JGijbPI4PJ0

(In case you don't actually want to watch it, IWillDominate built Zeke's to help out their double-AD comp.)
That's one game though, just because pro's do it doesn't mean it's necessarily good general item.

You're right, it's not a good general item. It's a niche item. If it were a good item for solo laners, then the aura would make it godlike-OP. So they leave it as a secretly-OP-in-certain-situations-but-not-most-of-the-time (aka niche) item. For comparison, most good junglers/supports recognize the value of an Aegis when the enemy has 2+ AP carries. A good AD or tank jungler/support/(top?) _should_ build Zeke's if they've got 2+ AD teammates, but you're right, it doesn't happen enough.

Fun math: Aegis costs 1900, and the stats on the buyer alone are [worth 1603](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Aegis_of_the_Legion#Cost_Analysis) (84% gold efficient). For every ally the aura benefits, its value goes up by 670, for a max of 2680 (225% gold efficient). Zeke's costs 2450 and is [worth 2590](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Zeke%27s_Herald#Cost_Analysis) to the buyer alone (106% gold efficient). The aura is worth 1270 for each ally it benefits, so Zeke's maxes out at 7670 (313% gold efficient). Granted, your mid LeBlanc won't care about the extra AD/LS, but even benefiting just two teammates takes Zeke's gold efficiency up to 209% (almost as much as a _maxed out_ Aegis).

I don't think the problem is that Zeke's is a weak item, but that people forget how good it can be in certain comps.

Top laners aren't going to bother building an aura item because they don't realize they have a team for the first 30 minutes, and supports aren't going to bother with it unless they're on a 3-4 AD team. Even then they have to sacrifice one of their more useful CDR items like athene's or FH.

They should just rework it. Would like to see it combined with or synergize with {{item:3504}} somehow. Which is in a similarly useless position, on top of only being a viable option on like 4 supports, but at least it doesn't suck up 20% CDR.
It's an excellent item in ARAM. Not every item has to be optimized for SR.
I like it on supports like Janna with adc's like Vayne who rush botrk (10% lifesteal isn't quite amazing yet, but *20%* during the early game can be quite the bitch especially against poke comps).

Used to be a core item on Nasus back in the day. It was so annoying going against a Nasus with +10% life steal 20% CDR and +20 Damage. Made him a living nightmare, not sure why people stopped building it :/

Probably because Nasus gets 30% CDR from Frozen Heart + Spirit Visage, and wouldn't really get bonus use from the aura while splitpushing. Not sure if it was those items that were changed to be better, Zeke's which was changed to be weaker, Nasus who was changed to benefit from different builds, or the meta that shifted and caused one of those things to happen indirectly, but I don't really see it replacing either of those items, being bought when pretty much all it's CDR would be wasted (as well as much of the aura a lot of the time), or a meta shift that makes teamfighting with multiple AD champions better than splitpushing for Nasus.

Not sure what they could do to make it viable outside of a heavy AD team without making it OP in one, and without removing its current identity. In a comp with a lot of AD the support should probably buy it eventually (don't want to take up a slot on a main damage dealer that could have a better item) but full AD has problems itself and Zeke's Herald doesn't fix them or even help much.

What it COULD do is add MAGIC damage to every auto attack in the aura, which would get around some of the armor stacking without needing to be built on a main damage dealer. Not sure how much damage that should be to be useful enough in high AD comps but avoid becoming core in every single game, but I think it might have more potential to find that sweet spot than the current version.
The problem with zekes is that it has a ton of hidden power. If it gives too many stats it can cause problems (Ie: getting 1 shot by a zed who somehow has 300 ad with only two long swords).

It's not built often because it's a niche item that's only good if you have two heavy hitting auto-attack based characters on your team.

It's fine right now, but it could always go for an upgrade that gives it more health.
